sen.j: 山本 孝（やまもと たかし、1936年9月18日 -）は大鼓方大倉流の能楽師。
sen.e: Takashi YAMAMOTO (September 18, 1936 -) is a Noh performer of Okura-ryu school for stick drums.
Takashi YAMAMOTO (September 18, 1936 -) is a Nohgakushi (Noh actor) playing stick drums of Okura-ryu school.
Takashi YAMAMOTO (September 18, 1936 -) is a Nohgakushi (Noh actor) playing stick drums of Okura-ryu school.

sen.j: 父である山本敬一郎（能楽師・大鼓方大倉流）及び亀井俊雄（能楽師・大鼓方葛野流宗家預かり・人間国宝）に師事。
sen.e: He learned Noh under his father, Keiichiro YAMAMOTO (Noh performer, the Okura-ryu school for stick drums) and Toshio KAMEI (Noh performer, the Soke-azukari (Acting head school), Kuzuno-ryu school for stick drums, and Living National Treasure).
sen.cmt: 大鼓方葛野流宗家預かり→「宗家預かり」の部分が定訳不明です：Noh performer, the Soke-azukari (Acting head school), Kuzuno-ryu school for stick drums としました。
sen.e: He learned Noh under his father, Keiichiro YAMAMOTO (Noh actor, playing stick drums of the Okura-ryu school) and Toshio KAMEI (Noh actor, the Soke-azukari [Acting head school], playing Kuzuno-ryu school, and Living National Treasure).

He learned Noh under his father, Keiichiro YAMAMOTO (Noh actor, playing stick drums of the Okura-ryu school) and Toshio KAMEI (Noh actor, the Soke-azukari [Acting head school], playing Kuzuno-ryu school, and Living National Treasure).

sen.j: 1978年、重要無形文化財総合指定を受け日本能楽会会員になる。
sen.e: In 1978, he was designated as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (general certificate), and became a member of The Association of Japanese Noh Payers.
sen.cmt: 重要無形文化財総合指定→定訳不明：the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (general certificate) としました。
sen.e: In 1978, he was designated as the general holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property, and became a member of The Association of Japanese Noh Payers.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: In 1978, he was designated as the general holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property, and became a member of The Association of Japanese Noh Payers.
In 2007, he received Kyokujitsusho (The Order of the Rising Sun).
In 2007, he received the Order of the Rising Sun.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: In 2007, he received the Order of the Rising Sun.
Former Directorof of The Nohgaku Performer's Association
sen.cmt: 理事→定訳不明：Director としました。 能楽協会→The Nohgaku Performer's Association[http://www.nohgaku.or.jp/download/guide_english.pdf]
sen.e: Former Director of of The Nohgaku Performer's Association.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを補足しました。
sen.e: Former Director of of The Nohgaku Performer's Association.
Director of The Association for Japanese Noh Plays
sen.cmt: 理事→定訳不明：Directorとしました。
sen.e: Director of The Association for Japanese Noh Plays.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを補足しました。
sen.e: Director of The Association for Japanese Noh Plays.

sen.j: 大阪能楽養成会大鼓主任講師。
sen.e: Chief instructor for stick drums of Osaka Nogaku Yoseikai (Osaka Nohgaku Training Academy).
sen.cmt: 大鼓主任講師→定訳不明：Chief instructor for stick drumsとしました。 大阪能楽養成会→定訳不明（）内英文は仮訳です：Osaka Nogaku Yoseikai (Osaka Nohgaku Training Academy)としました。
sen.e: Chief instructor for stick drums of Osaka Nohgaku Yoseikai (Osaka Nohgaku Training Academy).
Chief instructor for stick drums of Osaka Nohgaku Yoseikai (Osaka Nohgaku Training Academy).
Tetsuya YAMAMOTO (Noh performer) is his son.
Tetsuya YAMAMOTO (Noh actor) is his son.
Tetsuya YAMAMOTO (Noh actor) is his son.
Awards
Awards
Awards

sen.j: 1964年 『道成寺』にて大阪文化祭奨励賞
sen.e: 1964, he wan the Encouragement Prize of Osaka Cultural Festival for the performance in "Dojo-ji Temple."
1964: Awarded the Encouragement Prize of Osaka Cultural Festival for the performance in "Dojoji" (Dojo-ji Temple).
1964: Awarded the Encouragement Prize of Osaka Cultural Festival for the performance in "Dojoji" (Dojo-ji Temple).

sen.j: 1990年 『卒都婆小町』にて大阪府民劇場奨励賞
sen.e: 1990, he wan the Encouragement Prize of Osaka Citizen's Theater for his performance in "Sotoba Komachi"(Miss Komachi at gravepost)
1990: Awarded the Encouragement Prize of Osaka Citizen's Theater for his performance in "Sotoba Komachi"(Miss Komachi at gravepost).
1990: Awarded the Encouragement Prize of Osaka Citizen's Theater for his performance in "Sotoba Komachi"(Miss Komachi at gravepost).
In 1995, he received the Prize of Osaka Cultural Festival in "Hajitomi."
sen.cmt: 大阪文化祭賞 →定訳不明：the Prize of Osaka Cultural Festival としました
sen.e: 1995: Awarded the Prize of Osaka Cultural Festival in "Hajitomi" (The Lattice Shutter).
1995: Awarded the Prize of Osaka Cultural Festival in "Hajitomi" (The Lattice Shutter).

sen.j: 1997年 主催の山本同門会にて再び大阪文化祭賞
sen.e: 1997, he again wan the Prize of Osaka Cultural Festival for the presentation of Yamamoto Domon-kai (wrokshop of Yamamoto and his fellows) that he presides.
sen.cmt: 大阪文化祭賞 →定訳不明：the Prize of Osaka Cultural Festival としました 山本同門会→定訳不明（）内英文は仮訳です：Yamamoto Domon-kai (wrokshop of Yamamoto and his fellows)としました。
sen.e: 1997: Again awarded the Prize of Osaka Cultural Festival for the presentation of Yamamoto Domon-kai (workshop of Yamamoto and his fellows) that he presides.
sen.cmt: 年表表示にし、スペル修正しました。
sen.e: 1997: Again awarded the Prize of Osaka Cultural Festival for the presentation of Yamamoto Domon-kai (workshop of Yamamoto and his fellows) that he presides.

sen.j: 2003年 法政大学観世寿夫賞を受賞。
sen.e: 2003, he wan the Hosei University Noh Drama Prize in Memory of Kanze Hisao.
sen.cmt: 法政大学観世寿夫賞→Hosei University Noh Drama Prize in Memory of Kanze Hisao [http://www.princeton.edu/complit/neews/tharenohdramaorize]
sen.e: 2003: Awarded the Hosei University Noh Drama Prize in Memory of Kanze Hisao.
2003: Awarded the Hosei University Noh Drama Prize in Memory of Kanze Hisao.
